movies.title: Furtivos
movies.plot: Angel is a poacher who lives in the forest with his domineering mother. One day he goes to the city and meets Milagros, an escapee from a reform school and the lover of a known criminal so he takes her to his house in the mountains.
movies.simplePlot: Angel is a poacher who lives in the forest with his domineering mother. One day he goes to the city and meets Milagros, an escapee from a reform school and the lover of a known criminal so he takes her to his house in the mountains.

biography.bio: She goes to South America with her family in 1939 after the Spanish Civil War. There she begins her artistic career and follows in Spain in the theater companies of Mary Carrillo, Guillermo Marín and Mercedes Prendes. She has been one of the best supporting actresses of the Spanish cinema.
biography.name: Lola Gaos

biography.bio: At 12 years he worked as an apprentice mechanic, starting as an actor at age 20 and with the theater group of Alcoy natal "Casserole." In the mid-60's economic crisis forced him to emigrate to Barcelona, since then his career combining theatrical Companies Adrià Gual, CIFC and Nuria Espert with forays into the music scene. In 1968 he debuted as a professional singer, a facet that will become one of the main representatives of "Nova Cançó 'Catalan. In this sense, both composed their own songs as musical adaptations of Salvador Espriu, Pere Quart or Vicent Andrés. In the film debuted in 1974 and shortly thereafter obtained a great success for his role in "Stealth"
biography.name: Ovidi Montllor

biography.bio: Alicia Sánchez was born on May 27, 1949 in Madrid, Spain as María Alicia Sánchez Araujo. She is an actress, known for Barrio (1998), Furtivos (1975) and Celos (1999).
biography.name: Alicia Sánchez

biography.bio: His professional debut in 1934 with the Society of Enrique Rambal in a spectacular production of "Around the World in 80 Days." Upon completion of the Spanish Civil War, became part of the Society of Isabel Garcés Between 1940 and 1943 played important roles in various films. However, he soon returned to the theater, forming his own company, specializing in comedy. Stay in front of her, away from the film, until the '60s, when his face begins to lavish on the silver screen and television
biography.name: Ismael Merlo

biography.bio: Born in Zaragoza (Spain). 1949. He began to study law in Zaragoza. 1952. He began to publish articles about cinema in the newspaper "El Heraldo de Aragon". April 1954-January 1956. Critic of cinema in the same newspaper. 1957. Enters the spanish Instituto de Investigaciones y Experiencias Cinematograficas in Madrid (Official Cinema School) where he later become a teacher. 1964. Direction classes in the Cathedra of Cinema in the University of Valladolid. 1967. He funded his own production company, El Iman.
biography.name: José Luis Borau

biography.bio: Felipe Solano is an actor, known for A Touch of Class (1973), Furtivos (1975) and No One Heard the Scream (1973).
biography.name: Felipe Solano

biography.bio: José Luis Heredia is an actor, known for Furtivos (1975), Cousin Angelica (1974) and El canto del gallo (1955).
biography.name: José Luis Heredia

biography.bio: Erasmo Pascual was born on May 6, 1903 in Ribadavia, Ourense, Galicia, Spain as Erasmo Pascual Colmenero. He was an actor, known for Le bourreau (1963), Furtivos (1975) and Bell from Hell (1973). He was married to Rafaela Aparicio. He died on June 7, 1975 in Madrid, Spain.
biography.name: Erasmo Pascual

biography.bio: José Riesgo was born on September 8, 1919 in Madrid, Spain. He was an actor, known for The Mercenary (1968), Tristana (1970) and Furtivos (1975). He died on May 16, 2002.
biography.name: José Riesgo

biography.bio: Beni Deus was born on December 12, 1919 in A Coruña, Galicia, Spain as Venancio Deus Mejuto. He was an actor, known for Furtivos (1975), L'emprise du destin (1952) and They Came to Rob Las Vegas (1968). He died on March 16, 1989 in Madrid, Spain.
biography.name: Beni Deus

biography.bio: Antonio Gamero was born on March 2, 1934 in Madrid, Madrid, Spain as Antonio Gamero Aguirre. He was an actor and director, known for Manolito Four Eyes (1999), Madregilda (1993) and Furtivos (1975). He died on July 26, 2010 in Madrid.
biography.name: Antonio Gamero

biography.bio: Simón Arriaga is an actor, known for Django (1966), Tombs of the Blind Dead (1972) and The Mercenary (1968).
biography.name: Simón Arriaga

biography.bio: Francisco Ortuño is an actor, known for Furtivos (1975), Truhanes (1983) and La Sabina (1979).
biography.name: Francisco Ortuño

biography.bio: Eulalia Boya is an actress, known for Furtivos (1975), The Man Who Knew Love (1978) and Vuelve, querida Nati (1976).
biography.name: Eulalia Boya

biography.bio: Fernando Villena is an actor, known for Planet of the Vampires (1965), Night of the Seagulls (1975) and Furtivos (1975).
biography.name: Fernando Villena

categories.category: Best Spanish Movie Performer (Mejor intérprete de cine español)

titlesAwards.titleAwardOutcome: Won Prize of the National Syndicate of Spectacle

categories.category: Best Performance in a Spanish Film (Mejor Interpretación en Película Española)
